intro: Archidendron effeminatum, commonly known as the silky senna, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is distinguished by its soft, silky-hairy foliage and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its seed pods are elongated and contain several flat, rectangular seeds. Archidendron effeminatum is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
